data.shownotes: This was the first KGLW show since the beginning of the Covid-19 global pandemic and featured the debut of over a dozen songs (K.G.L.W. (Intro), If Not Now, Then When, Automation, Minimum Brain Size, Supreme Ascendency, Ontology, East West Link, Static Electricity, Ataraxia, Straws in the Wind, Pleura, Honey, Oddlife, K.G.L.W. (Outro) and The Reticent Raconteur), including many off of the then unreleased L.W. album. Leah Senior was shouted out before Straws in the Wind. Pleura was introduced as a song about Ambrose’s, Joey’s and Stu’s grandmas. Sleep Drifter contained Rattlesnake, Automation, and If Not Now, Then When? teases. Oddlife was introduced as a song about “life on the road”, followed by a humorous story by Amby about said life. Some Context was played for the first time since 2017-12-02. (149 show gap) The Reticent Raconteur and The Lord of Lightning featured narration by Leah Senior.

Ambrose was introduced as “The Shrimp Man” before Straws in the Wind. Billabong Valley contained Sleep Drifter and Rattlesnake teases. Sleep Drifter contained Honey and Nuclear Fusion teases. This show was released through the Official Bootlegger program as Live in Melbourne '21.

This show featured the live debuts of See Me and The Hungry Wolf of Fate. Sleep Drifter contained Nuclear Fusion teases. Nuclear Fusion did not include the throat singing intro. Prior to Pleura Stu led a call-and-response chant with the audience, leading Joey to ask “Freddie Mercury who?” Pleura was introduced as a song about Blu-ray. The Hungry Wolf of Fate was printed as “The Hungry Wolf of Fire” on the written setlist. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The available recordings of this show are incomplete (Honey missing; Rattlesnake & Straws in the Wind incomplete). The missing songs were confirmed via the written setlist for this show as well as contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations for the missing or incomplete songs that require audio confirmation (segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

Nuclear Fusion did not include the throat singing intro. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete, but only partial recordings exist. KGLW.net staff was only able to confirm KGLW (Intro), Doom City, Straws in the Wind, Nuclear Fusion, Honey and K.G.L.W. (Outro) through audio or video recordings. Despite the incomplete recordings, KGLW.net staff believes the setlist is complete based on contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that requires audio confirmation (segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

The Book was played for the first time since 2018-03-07. (135 show gap) D-Day was played for the first time since 2018-03-16. (127 show gap). Melting was played for the first time since 2019-07-06. (60 show gap) KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete, but only partial recordings exist. KGLW.net staff was only able to confirm K.G.L.W. (Intro) through audio or video recordings. Despite the incomplete recordings, KGLW.net staff believes the setlist is complete based on contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that requires audio confirmation (segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

As requested by Joey, Ambrose provided the vocal intro to Nuclear Fusion. Straws in the Wind contained Nuclear Fusion teases. The Book featured a Cavs drum solo. Before Supreme Ascendency, Joey remarked that the crowd and venue reminded him of The Great Gatsby. Tropical Fuck Storm was shouted out before The Hungry Wolf of Fate. This show was released through the Official Bootlegger program as Live in Sydney '21.

This show was part of the 2021 Meadow Music Festival KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete, but no recordings are available. KGLW.net staff believes the setlist is complete based on the written setlist for this show as well as contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

This show took place as part of the Splendour XR “Festival”, a virtual event meant to replace the yearly Splendour in the Grass Festival. Slow Jam 1 was played for the first time since 2014-12-19. (411 show gap)

This was the Microtonal Night show of the Princess Theatre residency, the third of five planned shows, each featuring a different specific genre and preannounced songs. The Book featured a drum solo by Cavs. Doom City was introduced as a song about planet Earth. Billabong Valley featured guest vocals by Grace Cummings. Rattlesnake contained teases of Sleep Drifter, Honey, O.N.E., Nuclear Fusion and Billabong Valley. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete, but only partial recordings exist. Recordings of K.G.L.W. (Intro) and Automation are unavailable and several other songs are incomplete. The missing songs were confirmed based on the preannounced song lists for each of the 5 planned genre specific shows and contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net. Poster By Jason Galea Edition of 200
Hell was introduced as a song about L.A.  Automation was introduced as a song about the near-term future.
This show featured the debut of Predator X.  Gaia featured a drum solo by Cavs.  Rattlesnake contained teases of Billabong Valley, O.N.E. and Automation.

Honey had teases from Billabong Valley and Sleep Drifter. Boogieman Sam had Cut Throat Boogie quotes. The Dripping Tap had I'm in your Mind quotes. After Honey, Stu says "give us that Tool beat", then says he was thinking of the wrong song and asks for that "Ginger Baker beat". Tezeta was played for the first time since 2019-10-07. (54 show gap) During Boogieman Sam, Stu was throwing some kind of food into the crowd, feeding it to the band, as well as tossing it in the air and catching it in his mouth.

I'm Not In Your Mind contained Am I In Heaven? and The Dripping Tap teases. The Balrog was played for the first time since 2019-10-16 (50 show gap). Wah Wah contained The River teases and Big Fig Wasp teases and quotes. Boogieman Sam contained Cut Throat Boogie quotes, Cyboogie quotes, “Got My Mojo Working” (Ann Cole) quotes, “Going Up the Country” (Canned Heat) quotes, “My Babe” (Little Walter) quotes, and a "La Grange" (ZZ Top) tease, as well as Stu on flute. Float Along - Fill Your Lungs contained a metal jam. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete. Portions of Gaia and Magenta Mountain through Float Along - Fill Your Lungs have been confirmed via audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed via the written setlist for the show and contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

Before Blame It On the Weather, Stu said they would play Vegemite next, but then clarified he was joking. After Blame It On The Weather, Stu tells a story of Joey sleepwalking and relieving himself on his new modular keyboard. Leading Joey to joke his new DJ name was Urine Man. The Garden Goblin was dedicated to Urine Man. During it, there was technical difficulty during which Stu discussed his accent. After The Garden Goblin, Joey says the song is about Cook’s dog, which Cook interjects, “yeah I miss him!” Work This Time featured a guitar solo. The Book featured a drum solo. Open Water was introduced as "one of our many songs about water" and also featured a drum solo. Float Along - Fill Your Lungs contained a metal jam.

Poster By Daniel Herwitt @sunflower_form
data.soundcheck: O.N.E.; Predator X; Sadie Sorceress; The Garden Goblin; The Book; Cranes, Planes, Migraines

data.shownotes: Third of five nights in Barcelona for Primavera Sound. Second show with replacement guitars for Stu's Holy Explorer & Joey's Flying V. Robot Stop contained The Dripping Tap teases and quotes. K.G.L.W (Intro) and Doom City were written on the printed setlist but were not played. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete. Robot Stop through Gamma Knife have been confirmed via audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed via contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

The Grim Reaper was introduced as a song about Michael Flatley's post-show warmdown. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete. Gaia and The Grim Reaper have been confirmed via audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed via contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

This show featured the live debut of A New World. Slow Jam 1 contained Ice V and Flamethrower teases, as well as Iron Lung quotes. The Grim Reaper featured an additional verse from Sadie Sorceress played over the music to The Grim Reaper followed by Sadie Sorceress quotes and teases. Ice V contained Slow Jam 1 quotes. A New World through Altered Beast II featured narration by Leah Senior. Altered Beast I was played for the first time since 2022-10-05 (90 show gap). Alter Me I and Altered Beast II were played for the first time since 2019-10-06 (87 show gap). Work This Time featured a guitar solo. Leah Senior was shouted out after Magma. The Dripping Tap contained Hypertension quotes and Hell’s Itch and Head On/Pill teases.

Poster by Jason Galea
320 Standard / 40 Foil Print

An I In Heaven? was teased prior to Magenta Mountain. The intro to O.N.E. contained Straws in the Wind teases. The River contained Wah Wah teases and quotes throughout, as well as Crumbling Castle teases. The Land Before Timeland was played over the PA as the setbreak music, which incidentally served as the “debut” for the studio track. Rattlesnake contained teases and quotes from O.N.E., Automation, Honey, and Minimum Brain Size, and teases of Sleep Drifter. Honey contained teases of Sleep Drifter and Billabong Valley. The Reticent Raconteur through The Balrog featured Leah Senior (introduced as “The Balrog” and “the best singer”) providing the narration. Ambrose quoted “Happy Birthday, Lisa” (The Simpsons) while referencing Joey’s “Australian birthday” prior to The Grim Reaper. The Grim Reaper was then introduced as “some weird-ass Satanic rap”. Venusian 2 and Am I in Heaven? were on the printed setlist but were replaced with Planet B due to time constraints. This show was released through the Official Bootlegger program as part of Live at Red Rocks ‘22. Poster By Jason Galea This is the first edition of this print

This show featured the debut of Red Smoke.  Gaia featured a Cavs drum solo over a metal vamp from the band. Leah Senior was shouted out after Hot Water.  Hot Water was reprised during Robot Stop. Work This Time featured a guitar solo.

Poster By Carlo Vivary

This show featured the live debut of Hypertension. The Reticent Raconteur and The Lord of Lightning were performed with Leah Senior providing the narration. I’m in Your Mind contained Cellophane teases. Cellophane contained Alter Me teases and quotes. Self-Immolate featured a Cavs drum solo which led into a brief metal vamp and ultimately returned to Self-Immolate. Rattlesnake contained Automation and Nuclear Fusion teases. Float Along - Fill Your Lungs contained a metal jam.
People-Vultures contained a “Down With the Sickness” (Disturbed) quote. Mr. Beat contained The Dripping Tap teases. Automation was dedicated to ChatGPT. Poster By Carlo Vivary

Let Me Mend The Past contained an It Ain't Me, Babe (Bob Dylan) quote. Sense was teased immediately before and during Ice V, which contained a Hypertension tease. Ambergris was introduced as “Joey’s porno song”. The Dripping Tap contained Hot Water teases and quotes with the lyrics changed to “time to party” and “everybody wants to party”, and Cellophane teases. Boogieman Sam contained “Going Up the Country” (Canned Heat), “Got My Mojo Working” (Ann Cole), “My Babe” (Little Walter) and “It's a Long Way to the Top (If You Wanna Rock 'N' Roll)” (AC/DC) quotes and Am I In Heaven? teases. Float Along – Fill Your Lungs contained a metal jam. Poster By Lewy Jones

Stu joined the opener Los Bitchos on flute for their cover of Trapdoor. Rattlesnake contained O.N.E. teases and had some of the "rattle, rattle, rattle" refrains changed to "boogie, boogie, boogie". Automation contained a false intro with Cavs playing the drumbeat to Muddy Water. Honey contained Rattlesnake quotes (with the "rattle, rattle, rattle" refrain changed to "Brussels, Brussels, Brussels"), Sleep Drifter teases and O.N.E. teases. An audience member named Mīkal was brought onstage to do the vocal intro to Nuclear Fusion. The O.N.E. intro contained Straws in the Wind teases. Magenta Mountain was introduced as a song about monkeys, then as a song about Lucas. Planet B was introduced as a song about monkeys, then space monkeys and finally "human monkeys". Self-Immolate featured a drum solo by Cavs followed by a brief metal vamp by the band. Planet B and Self-Immolate were dedicated to Michael Badger, a sound engineer/mixer on the studio versions of the tracks. I'm Not In Your Mind contained Witchcraft teases, Am I in Heaven? teases, The Dripping Tap teases/quotes and Hot Water teases/quotes with lyrics changed to "time to party". Cellophane contained "animals in Australia" quotes. The Balrog contained Evil Death Roll teases and Hypertension teases & quotes. Boogieman Sam had some of the "boogie, boogie, boogie" refrains changed to "Brussels, Brussels, Brussels" and contained “Whole Lotta Rosie” (AC/DC) teases, “Got My Mojo Working” (Ann Cole) quotes, “Going Up the Country” (Canned Heat) quotes, “Hells Bells” (AC/DC) teases, "animals in Australia" quotes, and Hypertension teases. Evil Death Roll and Presumptuous were on the printed setlist but were not played. Poster By Mr. Joe Johnson

This show featured the debut of Astroturf. Following the Mind Fuzz suite Amby quoted “Runnin’ With the Devil” (Van Halen). Magenta Mountain had lyrics changed to “I don’t believe Stu, his eyes deceive you.” Magenta Mountain contained a tease of The Grim Reaper. The Grim Reaper contained Torture Chamber quotes and featured an additional verse from Sadie Sorceress. Shanghai was on the printed setlist following The Grim Reaper and was attempted but not played due to technical difficulties. Ice V contained a Blindness (The Fall) jam. Poster By Jason Galea 215 Standard / 80 Foil Print

Evil Death Roll contained Converge teases and "Animals in Australia" quotes.  Shanghai featured a Grow Wings and Fly jam.  The vocal intro to Nuclear Fusion was performed by audience member, Axel, who was brought on stage.  Float Along - Fill Your Lungs contained a Dragon jam with lyrics.

Poster By Max Löffler

Grace Cummings unfortunately missed a fifth show due to illness, and was replaced with Australian rock band C.O.F.F.I.N., who were joined by Ambrose during their opening set. The Lord of Lightning contained Cellophane and Witchcraft teases. I'm Not In Your Mind contained Am I In Heaven? teases and Daily Blues teases and quotes. The Bitter Boogie contained the drums from Muddy Water, Head On/Pill teases, Rats In The Sky, Hog Calling Contest, Antarctica, and Daily Blues quotes. Cellophane contained Rattlesnake teases. Ben Portnoy (drummer of C.O.F.F.I.N) joined the band for Rattlesnake, which contained Automation, Honey, Billabong Valley, and Minimum Brain Size teases, Honey teases and quotes with the lyrics changed to "Mad Dog tastes like honey", Daily Blues, Boogieman Sam, Oddlife, and Straws In The Wind quotes, and an Oddlife and Billabong Valley jam with lyrics. Poster by Amy Jean; Edition of 150

Hot Water contained Robot Stop, Am I In Heaven?, and The Dripping Tap teases. Robot Stop, which was incomplete, contained Ice V, Daily Blues, and Am I In Heaven? teases and Field of Vision quotes. The second Hot Water contained a chant of "New York City". Ice V contained a "Blindness" (The Fall) jam and improvised lyrics. The Bitter Boogie contained the drums from Muddy Water and Ice V teases. You Can Be Your Silhouette was introduced as a song about being who you want to be. Hot Wax contained You Can Be Your Silhouette teases. Converge was introduced as a song about storms before Planet B, as Stu confused them on the setlist. The Great Chain of Being contained an "On The Road Again" (Canned Heat) tease. Motor Spirit was dedicated to Cavs "because it's about cars" and contained a You Can Be Your Silhouette and Robot Stop tease. Slow Jam 1 contained Crumbling Castle, Sad Pilot and Ice V teases. Billabong Valley was preceded by a "Microtonal Jazz Jam" with Stu referencing Sexy Alien and Joey singing The Star Spangled Banner. In the song itself, Ambrose crowdsurfed on an inflatable gator and quoted Should I Stay Or Should I Go (The Clash). Following Automation, Joey shouted out opener Geese. A crowd member then told the band to play Fishing For Fishies and the full band (besides Cavs) teased it. The band then started to name classic rock songs and teased Stairway To Heaven and Moby Dick (both Led Zeppelin), and Smoke On the Water (Deep Purple). Stu also shouted out Australian band Cold Chisel. Han-Tyumi, The Confused Cyborg contained a Hypertension tease. Am I In Heaven? contained Evil Death Roll, and Converge teases and Hot Water teases and quotes. Sad Pilot was on the printed setlist but was skipped.

Poster by Jason Galea
Standard Edition of 1200
Holographic Edition of 300

Before Theia, Ambrose quoted Fried. The song itself contained Motor Spirit quotes, a The River jam with Wah Wah quotes, and Motor Spirit and The Silver Cord jams with lyrics. Joey did Michael Jackson-style vocal improv in the intro to Ambergris, which was introduced as a song about sperm whales and contained a short drum solo. Joey did an impression of Guy Fieri before Rats In The Sky. Cavs teased Rock and Roll (Led Zeppelin) before Sad Pilot. After Rats in the Sky, the band heckled Jason Galea to join on tambourine. Before Flight b741, the band got Cavs to hit the gong on his kit. After Flight b741, the band explained that Geelong, aka G-troit, is the sister city to Detroit, as both had a Ford production factory, which closed and destroyed the town. Joey teased Purple Haze (Jimi Hendrix) and Cavs teased Rock and Roll again. You Can Be Your Silhouette contained an extended intro where the band talked about how their talkback mics work and jazz notes. During the song itself, which contained a The End (The Doors) quote, it was described as a song about being yourself. During the intro to Straws In The Wind, the band joked about Ambrose swimming over to Canada and Ambrose walked up to the lights and sound booth.  Nuclear Fusion featured Vincent, a kid from the audience on the intro. Following the intro, Joey teased Twist (Korn). After Nuclear Fusion, Stu shouted out the stream crew. Honey contained O.N.E teases. Minimum Brain Size was introduced as a song about "loser hypermasculine people."  Prior to Rattlesnake Joey conducted a Q&A session with crowd members and Sam. Prior to Billabong Valley, Cavs ran offstage. During Billabong Valley, Joey said he can do a Limp Bizkit beat cause he doesn’t have an electric guitar and doesn’t want to take it to the [Dave] Matthews Bridge, followed by Ambrose climbing on top of the equipment truck on the side of the venue, leading to the line “I’m on the truck!” Her and I (Slow Jam 2), which was last played 2023-06-18 (50 show gap), contained a Slow Jam 1 intro as well as Iron Lung teases.

Poster by Jason Galea
Standard Edition - 600
Foil Edition- 200

Venusian 1 was last played 2023-03-11 (87 show gap). Witchcraft was swapped for Flamethrower because Stu had forgotten they played it the night before. Rattlesnake contained O.N.E., Automation, Minimum Brain Size, Sleep Drifter, Oddlife, and Honey teases, Am I In Heaven? vocal teases by Ambrose, and Boogieman Sam quotes. The intro to Gondii contained Shanghai quotes with some lyrics changed to “Bye Bye Chang’e” and the song itself contained Shanghai teases. Magma contained a Rats In The Sky intro. Sea of Trees contained a The Land Before Timeland tease, a You Can Be Your Sillouhette jam, and Daily Blues teases. Gamma Knife contained Motor Spirit teases and quote.

Poster by Amy Jean

Altered Beast I was played for the first time since 2023-06-16 (96 shows), Alter Me I was played for the first time since 2024-05-18 (64 shows), and Altered Beast II was played for the first time since 2024-03-14 (72 shows). Raw Feel contained Am I In Heaven? and Head On/Pill teases. Boogieman Sam featured a guitar/harmonica duel between Joey & Amby and contained teases of Sad Pilot & The Bitter Boogie, a Mirage City jam, Altered Beast II teases and Phantom Island quotes. Chang'e was unfinished. After Hell, Joey introduced the rest of the band, followed by Stu introducing Joey. The audience then chanted "free free Palestine!"; the band encouraged them to "say that shit louder!".
data.soundcheck: Altered Beast Suite, Venusian 1, Predator X, Mirage City
